definition: A thing characteristic of its kind or illustrating a general rule.
A round fruit with red or green skin and a whitish interior.
A long curved fruit with a yellow skin.
Identification of a disease or condition based on symptoms and tests.
A written order from a doctor for medicine or treatment.
A drug used to treat bacterial infections.
A substance that helps the body build immunity against disease.
A physical or mental sign indicating illness.
Treatment intended to relieve or heal a disorder.
A medical procedure involving an operation to treat a condition.
The invasion of the body by harmful microorganisms.
Swelling and redness caused by injury or infection.
A condition lasting a long time or recurring often.
A condition with a rapid onset and usually short duration.
A drug-induced loss of feeling or awareness.
An abnormal growth of tissue, which can be benign or malignant.
An immune system reaction to a normally harmless substance.
The bodyâ€™s defense system against infections and diseases.
A tiny infectious agent that can only multiply inside living cells.
A microorganism that causes disease.
The rhythmic beat of the heart felt in the arteries.
A diagnostic test that uses radiation to view inside the body.
The study of drugs and their effects on the body.
